places_to_visit.name: Santa Cruz Island
places_to_visit.description: Santa Cruz Island is one of the main islands in the Galápagos archipelago. It is home to the Charles Darwin Research Station, where visitors can learn about conservation efforts and see giant tortoises. The island also features beautiful beaches and lush highlands.

places_to_visit.name: Isabela Island
places_to_visit.description: Isabela Island is the largest island in the Galápagos and offers diverse landscapes, including volcanic craters, lava fields, and beautiful beaches. Key attractions include the Sierra Negra Volcano and the Galápagos Flamingo Lagoon.

places_to_visit.name: Genovesa Island
places_to_visit.description: Genovesa Island, also known as 'Bird Island,' is renowned for its abundant birdlife. The island is home to various species of seabirds, including red-footed boobies and frigatebirds. Visitors can explore its volcanic landscapes and snorkel in its crystal-clear waters.

places_to_visit.name: Española Island
places_to_visit.description: Española Island is known for its unique wildlife and dramatic landscapes. It is the only place where the Española mockingbird is found and is famous for its large populations of sea lions and marine iguanas.

Prepare for variable weather and bring layers for cooler temperatures in the highlands.
